column4: I have 2 versions of linux now with a security upgrade  i think its 2.9 and 2.10 something like that. can I just remove the 2.9 link to boot to that, I wouldnt need it anymore
I dont boot to anything but the top one and XP sometimes
you can remove the kernels you don't use, yes.
ok just so I dont scRREw up Im gonna pastebin them
/boot/grub right?
no problem
yeah it'll be /boot/grub/menu.lst or something along those lines
you'll want to use nano, vi, or emacs to edit the file
not gedit?
gedit is fine :)
sorry im just about to do that grub thing, busy for a min here
no problem :) I actually have to run out but I'm sure someone here can help you if you have any questions
ok mate, yea no biggie check ya later
wow, what kind of system are you running?
that should be plenty of speed
i can hear it reading the DVD
you have a giant paperweight :)
nah, thats just nothing compared to the HP scanner, thats a boat anchor
heh, i still have an HP laserjet 4v printer...best printer i've ever owned
even the mexicans will look at you and tell you to go away heh
yeah they were built better, I just dont know who will buy this big scanner, its the best ive owned
theyve gotten smart
